Description: One day Prof. Slim decided to leave the kingdom of the GUC to join the kingdom of the GIU. He was given an easy online assessment to solve before joining the GIU. Citizens of the GUC were happy sad to see the prof leaving so they decided to change the assessment into a harder one. After a long argument, they decided to change it into the following problem. Given an array of $$$n$$$ integers $$$a_1,a_2,\ldots,a_n$$$, where $$$a_{i} \neq 0$$$, check if you can make this array sorted by using the following operation any number of times. select two indices $$$i$$$ and $$$j$$$ ($$$1 \le i,j \le n$$$) such that $$$a_{i}$$ and $$$a_{j}$$ have different signs. The operation swaps the signs of the two indices. For example, if you have $$$a_{i} = 3$$ and $$$a_{j} = -2$$, the operation would change them to $$$a_{i} = -3$$ and $$$a_{j} = 2$$$. The task is to determine if the array can be sorted in non-decreasing order.

ls = []

sys.stderr.write("-- output --\n")

    k = sum([0 if ai > 0 else 1 for ai in a])
    b = [abs(a[i]) if i >= k else -abs(a[i]) for i in range(n)]
    for i in range(n-1):
        if b[i] > b[i+1]:

    a = [int(x) for x in ls[i+1].split(' ')]
    print(solve(n, a))

Description: Timur's grandfather gifted him a chessboard to practice his chess skills. This chessboard is a grid $$$a$$$ with each cell having a non-negative integer written on it. The task is to place a bishop on the board such that the sum of all cells attacked by the bishop is maximal. The bishop attacks along the diagonals, so each diagonal's attacked cells are summed and the maximal sum is desired.

Input Specification: The first line of input contains a single integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \le t \le 1000$$$) — the number of test cases. Then $$$t$$$ lines follow, each line contains the integers $$$n$$ and $$$m$$ ($$$1 \le n \le 200$$, $$$1 \le m \le 200$$$) — the dimensions of the chessboard. The following $$$n$$$ lines contain $$$m$$$ integers each describing the cells of the chessboard.

The code:

for _ in range(int(input())):
    n,m=map(int, input().split())
    a = [ [*map(int, input().split())] for _ in range(n)]
    u = [0]*(n+m-1)
    v = [0]*(n+m-1)
    for i in range(n):
        for j in range(m):
            u[i+j] += a[i][j]
            v[i-j] += a[i][j]
    for i in range(n):
        for j in range(m):
            current = u[i+j] + v[i-j] - a[i][j]
            max_val = max(max_val, current)
    print(max_val)
